page.title: 01Wittersham
page.content: Wittersham Village was covered with forest until the Romans chopped the trees down. It is on the Isle of Oxney which used to be an island and some of it today is reclaimed marshland. The village is small but it has 2 pubs and 2 garages. The Post Office is run by a lady who has been here for 17 years. There is an Off-Licence, 2 antique shops, a food store, a grain store and a coal yard. There are several small businesses including a hand made furniture business, and a coach works which mends and sprays cars. It also has a church and a Primary school. Children of 11 and over go into Tenterden to Homewood School. There is a Doctors' Surgery in the village 3 afternoons a week otherwise people have to go into Tenterden.
